It's not directly fault of OnePlus company that they don't develop newer systems (Nougat/Oreo) for this phone, it's mainly fault of Snapdragon company which decided to discontinue support for their Adreno 330 GPU graphics (which were used by the Snapdragon 800 and 801 processors family (OPX uses snapdragon 801)). So OPX ended up with Marshmallow Android (6), but I don't think that's a bad thing. This system is actually pretty stable and without any flaws (I did not experience any so far). If numbers are what you seek (eg. to always have "highest" Android version in "About phone" screen, then buy Nexus/Pixel). Alternatively you can use 3rd party ROM such LineageOs/CyanogenMod - they managed to port and rework GPU libraries needed to run Nougat on Snapdragon 800/801 processors, so you can have Nougat (and I personally expect in future Oreo as well) on OPX too.  
I own this phone and I am happy with it. It's kinda bulky and heavy, but considering it is all glass and metal, I should not have anything against it. I had only one problem so far on this phone - for some reason, if haptic feedback is enabled (vibrations), then SwiftKey keyboard (which I use a lot) tends to ignore key touches till vibration of previously pressed character ends. That means that if you are a "fast writer", you can end up with text you did not want to write (because of missing characters it might turn into unreadable cipher). Easy solution how to prevent this problem is to use another keyboard (like Gboard from Google) or turn off vibrations in SwiftKey settings. Then it's a perfect phone. :)

Have had this phone for 2 days.
 
Good phone, beautiful design, nice interface. Screen is smaller than the big one I was used to, but OS design is really nice. Really nice feel in the hand. Camera is good, speakers ok. Happy with the speed although on occasion the phone feels warm in my hand. Doesn't overheat though.
 
Cons: 
 
- Battery life is short, I just had wifi on and screen set to default brightness (not the lowest setting) and by half the day I had 70% battery. In fact, I just charged it to 100% 15 mins ago and now it's already 98% and all I did was check whatsapp. 
 
- I can't switch from normal to silent to non-vibrate mode easily (via the shortcuts menu in other phones). In fact, I'm not sure still how to switch to non-vibrate quickly
 
- the default music player is shit, barely any functions. but actually a lot of music players are shit. Can't exclude folders (the .nomedia trick works but too well, then the app that needs the podcasts can't detect the podcasts lol). I actually installed the huawei music player, it's a mediocre app with some bloat, but at least they have a filter that filters out folders you don't want to detect.
 
- Internal storage is very limited (phone says 11.54 gigs), apps like whatsapp (and whatsapp-associated media) and spotify don't store on the SD card.
 
Other than that, I'm actually quite happy with the phone.

Its just a complete crap, good for nothing phone (except the design, and I don't think it deserves a 15K price tag only for design).

Oxygen OS is a complete package of bugs, its too laggy. Best thing of this phone you don't have a camera, the one provided with this one can't even be compared to the one Samsung S duos (I have compared the pictures, s duos gives better pictures than one plus x). 
Sound doesn't seems good, you wont be able hear the rings when you are in a crowd, even the 3.5 jack doesn't gives a satisfactory output. 
About the display, when you are comparing the same with other AMLOED displays, the one provided on this phone is below par. Is does have a color shade (whites doesn't feels like the exact color when comparing to other phones), you can easily notice frame drops when playing games (even when playing super cricket 2).
 
Overall its just a waste of money. Now its up to you...

I agree, i found it to be the best bang for your buck.  
Also, you can easily install Marshmallow with CyanogenMod 13... bunch of how to guides to get it done.... if OOS3 decides to never come out for this under-1-year phone... would be a shame...
 
Anyway, my experience and thoughts of the phone are as follows: 
The size is perfect, screen is gorgeous, phone feels/looks premium, runs superbly well, no issues with call quality or signal (coverage will vary in your area), has a microsd slot via its dual sim tray (sim2 allows microsd installation), camera is very good in bright light (not too bad in low light)... for just 300$ ... can't complain.
 
oh yea, has FM radio, which overall works pretty good, except for one station in my area... 95.9, not sure if it's the phone's FM receiver, but volume fluctuates up and down constantly, making the listening experience.. non-existent! sad... cause it's the main station i listen too, and thus makes the FM receiver useless for me. oh well.
 
storage is ok, 16gb is low, but QUICK! (approx. 200MB/s read speeds) i am greatful they included a microsd slot which allows us to have the photos/videos we take saved onto there... Apps can be moved to that storage as well. 
the read/write speed of the microsd are quite... on the low end (slow end?)... i found it to not even be capable of reaching 30MB/s read and top out at approx. 20MB/s on the write.... even though i have a card that should reach 80MB/s+ read speeds .... could it be a driver issue? maybe hardware? *shrugs* 
not a deal breaker, but other phones, with same card, perform much closer to rated specs.
 
battery is not too bad and has been consistent for me. i get roughly 1hr25min (+/- 10min) screen on time for every 30% battery drain. so theoretically i should get about 4.25-5hours screen on time before my battery forces the phone off.
 
overall phone is great, just wish the company would push their devs to update this phone quicker to fix bugs and performance issues that can occur... If the don't update this phone, there will be a lot of unhappy angry opx users which will likely cause them to lose a shit ton of potential new customers... all this if they do decide to neglecting us! hope not!

After 3 months of usage:- 
1. Display (3.8/5) is awesome as it is amoled panel (its crisp, bright and very rich). Color calibration is good but not best and same goes with the brightness. Sunlight eligibility is awesome. The side black areas might irritate few.
 
2. Performance (3.5/5) is great considering its an old processor SD801. No lags and hiccups.
 
3. Design (4.7/5) is what makes this phone awesome. But the downside lies as it is slipry and glass panel needs care. Dont fall this phone.
 
4. Battery (3/5) Only average battery performance. Maybe Android 6  update can help.
 
5. Oxygen OS; best os if u want simple but customisable os. few bugs are there but they r very small n difficult to notice. 
 
6 Camera. (3.5/5) under sunlight its very impressive. Go to low light n it struggles. Manual mode helps a lot but needs time n skill. overall its good camera. shutter speed is very fast n images are crisp n usable.

I have OnePlus X for three months now and also have Sony Xperia M5 with Helio X10 MTK processors. I sometimes switch over to the Sony M5 but always come back to the OnePlusX. Its perfect size, slim shape and performance with the Qualcomm Snapdragon 801 processor is better than the Sony MTK. The Amoled screen is is beautiful, far more vivid colours than the Sony M5 or my other LG G3. As others have said, the battery needs a midday 'liven up', but most phones do anyway. Yes, its only 16GB but virtually any application can be moved over to the SD Memory card. 
I have a white one and keep the rear and gold bezel protected with a crystal clear Imak case so the attractive look of the phone is still shown. The factory fitter screen protector is great and does not collect finger marks very much. All in all I recommend this phone highly. Best price anywhere is from eGlobal in Hong Kong, shipping is around AUD$25

I have bought Oneplus X 2 days ago and here is my review.  
Display: Better than Samsung J5, J7, HTC, Lg G2 and G3 as well. Sharpness very good. Color tone nice.  
Camera: Better than Samsung J5, J7, both front and Back. Satisfied with Camera.  
Battery: Average. Compared with iPhone 6s. Both r almost same.  
Performance: Very fast. Compared with LG G2. Oneplus X is Faster than LG G2. Even better result than Samsung J5 n J7 too.  
Gaming: Gaming performance is also good. Played Asphalt 8 both in Oneplus X and iPhone 6s. Performance is good, not so much laggy at all but it is super smooth in iPhone 6s. It's almost like 1080p 60ps video vs. 720p video song. So, I am satisfied and as far I know Asphalt 8 is a very high end game (900mb+ in android and 1.7GB+ in iOS).  
Bad side: It becomes a little bit over heated while playing online games or high end games for a long time but set performance still remains the same. I don't have got any other issue without this one though I knew it before buying. :) 
According to the price it is a good mobile set. Design is just Awesome. :)

For those fellows who are saying that there is a battery issue, let me tell you friends if you'll charge your Oneplus X to 100% & let it charge for 10 additional minutes, you won't have any battery issues. This additional 10 minutes charge is also known as trickle stage of charging & it should be only done after unboxing (without using the device for 1st time). You can do this with all your smartphones & trust me it definitely works tremendously. This trick really increases battery life on Apple iPhone 5 by almost 30% so try this after unboxing all your smartphones.

I am a genuine Oneplus x cell phone user, 3days back I updated the OS as launched but the thing is, there are still several bugs as follows:- 
1) dual sim problem - even though selecting "ask      every time" option for out - going calls, its taking only 1st sim. 
2) there is no end call notification for data on/off - that black dail box saying xyz kB/MB is consumed. 
3) I found non periodic vibrations during in call - I am damn sure its not for minute remainder. 
4) there is no manual flash on/off option for camera to click pictures in "photo" mode - but its there in video mode. 
5) there is no face detection, smile detection options in settings - auto focus doesn't work only. 
6) there is no minute remainder in call settings option. 
7) there is no video call n call recorder option in dialing launcher. 
8)  if I remove the Google search bar, the menu entry is malfunctioning by giving recent used apps. 
9) in sim settings, we can only have the access to modify the sim name, but not accessible to put our sim number (i.e,948*******). 
10) there is no one click exit (x - mark at the top of all recently opened apps) option to exit the apps that are running at background.

I recently bought this phone. As I started exploring the phone, my disappointment kept increasing. My list of disappointments is as below:
 
1. It says the phone is dual sim with extendable memory, but there are only two slots so either you can use it as dual sim or one sim with memory card. After installing few apps what I got as user space is just 8GB which I think is very less.
 
2. There is a google search bar by default on home screen, which you just can't remove.
 
3. There are lot of bugs in the phone software, for example it happened twice with me that I had to unlock phone to answer call. 
 
4. It doesn't show notifications on app icons, for example if there are 20 unread messages in whatsapp, it doesn't show the number on the icon.
 
5. There is no email client available, you need to install it. I installed outlook free version, but still not able to configure it. I used email in my previous phone S5 with same settings, so this also look some issue with phone only.
 
6. Battery backup is also not so good, I have to charge phone twice a day with even very less usage.
 
So overall phone is total crap, the only thing which I am looking forward now is 3GB RAM. I would suggest not to buy this phone.

last night i receive oxygen update 2.1.3, and thank god it has fixed the sd card problem and now apps can be moved to it, also the most important thing is that now the device support exfat format which means you can attach and external hard disc using otg but it should have the format exfat and not ntfs.
 
those who dont know please note that and external hd has only two formats ntfs (which is a default one) and exfat, and so if you format the hd with exfat format then your hd can be readable with your oneplus x.

Interesting. I am a bit disappointed...but I am not quite sure why. When compared to the Moto G 3rd gen with 16GB and 2GB of RAM - this OnePlus X is $30 more but...
 
The X has more RAM (2gb vs 3gb)
 
The X is significantly smaller (11.6mm thick vs 6.9mm...other dimensions favor the X as well)
 
The X officially supports larger SD card sizes. Yes, the Moto G will support sizes larger than 32GB but not officially. So...this one probably doesn't matter.
 
The X has a bigger battery (2470 vs 2525).
 
The X's CPU "should" be better than the Moto G's (410 vs 801). 
 
The X "can" support dual SIMs...but at the cost of the SD card slot. So depending on your needs this might be a bonus or not.

 
Of course, there are quite a few niceties for the Moto G as well. Historically it should have better support. 6.0 is already officially planned. It supports waaaay more bands. Just don't expect much dev support on this one - so far there's limited development for MediaTek chipsets' wielding devices, since the aforementioned company's reluctant to release their CPUS' baseline codes and their original codes for kernels - meaning that devs cannot do shit since they simply won't have a start point to work from - the coding of the CPU and chipset itself - only some limited features are available currently, at least with my MX4 (Meizu) - and its MT6595 (4x1.7Ghz&4x2.2Ghz cores with Meizu's tweak allowing all eight to work simultaneously). 
PS: Also, don't expect wonders from this GPU - again, the MX4 I got has the same GPU only with 4 cores instead of the standard two which this one has - and even though it has enough GFLOPs and overall power for a 1080p display, and even 1440p - it will struggle with highly intensive scenes at demanding games - when playing at high graphics settings - a great example would be a game where there are dozens of soldiers/cars/units of any kind - complex units - on the screen simultaneously, at these scenarios my phone starts struggling and drops frames like no one's business if I don't use mid-low settings, this GPU simply can't give the per-core performance the Adreno 420/Mali-T760 can - and it's too bad - PowerVR lots of great GPUs - ones which can destroy even the T760MP8, but almost no company besides Apple is currently using those, unfortunately - the G6630 and the GX6650 are both six-cored GPUs with a HUGE leap over the eight cored Mali 760 and the adreno 420 430 both. 
Too bad, the GX series especially could take anything relating to smartphone graphics, at all current resolutions. 
TL:DR out.
